name: CAT (Common Admission Test)
description: A computer-based national-level management aptitude test for admission to postgraduate management programs (MBA/PGP) in Indian Institutes of Management (IIMs) and other leading business schools across India.
conductingBody: One of the Indian Institutes of Management (IIMs) on a rotational basis.

eligibility.ageLimit: No age limit to apply for the CAT exam.
eligibility.educationalQualification: A Bachelor's degree with at least 50% marks or equivalent CGPA (45% for SC, ST, and PwD candidates). Final year students are also eligible to apply.
eligibility.nationality: No restrictions on nationality. However, candidates must check the admission policies of individual institutes.

timeline.notificationDate: Typically released in the last week of July.
timeline.applicationStartDate: Typically starts in the first week of August.
timeline.applicationEndDate: Typically ends in the third week of September.
timeline.examDate: Last Sunday of November annually. (For 2024, it is November 24, 2024).
timeline.resultDate: Typically announced in the last week of December or the first week of January.

stages.name: Stage 1: CAT Exam
stages.description: A single-session, 2-hour online test divided into three sections: Verbal Ability & Reading Comprehension (VARC), Data Interpretation & Logical Reasoning (DILR), and Quantitative Aptitude (QA).

stages.name: Stage 2: WAT, GD & PI
stages.description: Candidates shortlisted based on CAT scores are called by individual IIMs and other B-schools for the next stage of selection, which typically includes a Written Ability Test (WAT), Group Discussion (GD), and Personal Interview (PI).

examPattern.markingScheme: For MCQs: +3 for a correct answer, -1 for an incorrect answer. For Non-MCQs (TITA - Type In The Answer): +3 for a correct answer, 0 for an incorrect answer. No marks for unattempted questions.

syllabus.name: Quantitative Aptitude (QA)
topics: Arithmetic (Number System, Percentage, Profit & Loss, TSD, etc.)
